comment.author: 13810401@N07
comment._content:
Very interesting for me, as Thomas Wynne was my Great-great Grandfather. His daughter Mary opened a branch of the photographic business in Loughrea, and married my Great Grandfather in 1894.

Somewhere in a cupboard is an old photo album with some of the family prints in.....

comment.author: 47290943@N03
comment._content: [http://www.flickr.com/photos/mikehannon] Amazing, Mike, what a ridiculously small world!! We'll be adding more photos from our Wynne collection over the next while - let's know what you think... Meantime, you should rummage in that cupboard!
comment.authorname: National Library of Ireland on The Commons

comment.author: 13810401@N07
comment._content:
I've added yo as a contact, so I can keep an eye out for more on here from your archives.
 
I've scanned two prints from the album, converted them from their fading yellow to black and white, and uploaded them to my photo-stream. I have to say I've no idea who the photographer was in either case. The full length portrait is pretty much self explanatory, but the group around the still is quite interesting. Nothing to say who the group members are, or where the location is.

Perhaps you could shed some light on the matter?

comment.author: 44911068@N03
comment._content: Mayo Again !!!  1798 " The Races of Castlebar " !!!

comment.author: 30369211@N00
comment._content: Wynne's shop is still there, on the right (painted black), with a sign saying Est. 1864
